workflows.name: Self managed

steps.name: Configure Data-Prepper Metrics exporter
steps.label: Metrics Exporter
steps.description: Configure Data-prepper Metrics pipeline and export into opensearch index
steps.content:
otel-metrics-pipeline:
  workers: 8
  delay: 3000
  source:
    otel_metrics_source:
      health_check_service: true
      ssl: false
  buffer:
    bounded_blocking:
      buffer_size: 1024 # max number of records the buffer accepts
      batch_size: 1024 # max number of records the buffer drains after each read
  processor:
    - otel_metrics:
        calculate_histogram_buckets: true
        calculate_exponential_histogram_buckets: true
        exponential_histogram_max_allowed_scale: 10
        flatten_attributes: false
  sink:
    - opensearch:
        hosts: ["<<https://opensearch-domain.com>>"]
        username: "<<username>>"
        password: "<<password>>"
        insecure: true
        index_type: custom
        index: ss4o_metrics-otel-%{yyyy.MM.dd}
        bulk_size: 4
        template_type: index-template

steps.name: Configure Data-Prepper inside Otel Collector
steps.label: OTEL Collector Metrics services
steps.description: Configure Data-prepper Pipelines within the Otel Processor Metrics pipeline
steps.content:
otlp/metrics:
    endpoint: "data-prepper:21891"
    tls:
      insecure: true
      insecure_skip_verify: true 
  service:
  pipelines:
    metrics:
      receivers: [otlp, spanmetrics]
      processors: [filter/ottl, transform, batch]
      exporters: [otlphttp/prometheus, otlp/metrics, debug]

workflows.name: AWS
workflows.description: This is a workflow for connecting into an existing Otel Collector

steps.name: Configure AWS OpenSearch ingestion services metrics pipeline
steps.label: Metrics Exporter
steps.description: Configure Data-prepper metrics pipeline and export into opensearch index
steps.content:
version: "2"
otel-metrics-pipeline:
  source:
    otel_metrics_source:
      # Provide the path for ingestion. ${pipelineName} will be replaced with sub-pipeline name, i.e. otel-metrics-pipeline, configured for this pipeline.
      # In this case it would be "/otel-metrics-pipeline/v1/metrics". The value of the "metrics_endpoint" for the OpenTelemetry exporter should be
      # https://<ingestion-endpoint-url>/otel-metrics-pipeline/v1/metrics
      path: "/${pipelineName}/v1/metrics"
  processor:
    # For more configuration parameters, see https://opensearch.org/docs/latest/data-prepper/pipelines/configuration/processors/otel-metrics/
    - otel_metrics:
  sink:
    - opensearch:
        # Provide an AWS OpenSearch Service domain endpoint
        hosts: [ "<<https://search-mydomain-1a2a3a4a5a6a7a8a9a0a9a8a7a.us-east-1.es.amazonaws.com>>" ]
        aws:
          # Provide a Role ARN with access to the domain. This role should have a trust relationship with osis-pipelines.amazonaws.com
          sts_role_arn: "<<arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/Example-Role>>"
          # Provide the region of the domain.
          region: "<<us-east-1>>"
          # Enable the 'serverless' flag if the sink is an Amazon OpenSearch Serverless collection
          serverless: false
        # serverless_options:
          # Specify a name here to create or update network policy for the serverless collection
          # network_policy_name: "network-policy-name"
        index: "metrics"
        # Enable the 'distribution_version' setting if the AWS OpenSearch Service domain is of version Elasticsearch 6.x
        # distribution_version: "es6"
        # Enable and switch the 'enable_request_compression' flag if the default compression setting is changed in the domain. See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/opensearch-service/latest/developerguide/gzip.html
        # enable_request_compression: true/false
        # Optional: Enable the S3 DLQ to capture any failed requests in an S3 bucket. Delete this entire block if you don't want a DLQ.
        dlq:
          s3:
            # Provide an S3 bucket
            bucket: "<<your-dlq-bucket-name>>"
            # Provide a key path prefix for the failed requests
            # key_path_prefix: "apache-log-pipeline/logs/dlq"
            # Provide the region of the bucket.
            region: "<<us-east-1>>"
            # Provide a Role ARN with access to the bucket. This role should have a trust relationship with osis-pipelines.amazonaws.com
            sts_role_arn: "<<arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/Example-Role>>"

steps.name: Configure OSIS pipeline inside OTEL collector
steps.label: OSIS collector
steps.content:
extensions:
  sigv4auth:
    region: "__AWS_REGION__"
    service: "osis"

receivers:
  otlp:

exporters:
  otlphttp/metrics:
    metrics_endpoint: "https://__REPLACE_WITH_OtelMetrics_ENDPOINT__/v1/metrics"
    auth:
      authenticator: sigv4auth
    compression: none

service:
  extensions: [sigv4auth]
  pipelines:
    metrics:
      receivers: [otlp]
      exporters: [otlphttp/metrics]
